body.p: When editing an XML document either in the Text or in the Author editing modes you can invoke the content completion window (Ctrl-Space in the Text editing mode or ENTER in the Author viual editing mode) to see the allowed XML elements or attributes which can be inserted at the caret position. In addition the Elements view also presents the elements which can be inserted in the document at a certain position. Also the Attributes view presents a list of attributes and for each attribute a set of values are proposed.

The content completion proposals can be customized in various ways:
Each framework can contain a special content completion configuration file: . Such a file can:
Filter out element proposals for a parent element.
Configure a set of required attributes which will get inserted along with a certain element.
Add new attribute value proposals and for each proposal add an annotation which will appear in the Attributes view for each value.
Call an external XSLT script to compute value proposals for a certain attribute.
Customize how the element names are presented in the Outline, Elements view and Content Completion proposals window.
By altering the schema which is associated to the XML document. For example in the case of the DITA vocabulary you may create a DTD specialization plugin and integrate it in Oxygen: .
By using tin a framework configuration the SchemaManagerFilter API to filter using Java code the set of proposed elements and attribute values.
